attributes.action: Stop charging students council tax on property rented for graduating year
attributes.background: Students are exempt from paying council tax however if a student is still living in student accommodation after they’ve graduated, they’re expected to pay the remaining months, even though their finically situation is still the same or most of the time, even worse.
attributes.additional_details: Contracts are only available for 12 months from most letting agents therefor trapping students into a fee that most of them can’t afford or have to pay with their student loan which is supposed to be used to help forward they’re education and living costs. We still have to pay this loan back and being forced to give a large amount of it away for a period of time in which you can’t control is very worrying. The exemption of students paying council tax should last their whole tenancy agreement.

attributes.action: Extend the maximum length of a caravan towed by a 3.5 tonne vehicle from 7m
attributes.background: The current law stops you towing a caravan more than 7m long with anything less than 3.5 tonne vehicle when a lot of vehicles less than 3.5 tonne are capable of towing these caravans
attributes.additional_details: There seems to be more and more caravans now especially foreign caravans that are more than 7m long these can currently only be towed with a vehicle more than 3.5 tonne a lot of people still tow illegally with less than 3.5 tonne as most campsites don’t allow Comercial vehicles so this makes it hard to stay legal and still be able to enjoy using bigger family friendly caravans

attributes.action: Require care providers and all staff to be qualified and registered
attributes.background: Care is in crisis. There are regular reports of older and vulnerable people being abused and neglected. Most carers are hard-working professionals, but to increase confidence and standards everyone in the care industry should be regulated.
attributes.additional_details: Staff at every level should be registered, increasing protection for the vulnerable but also placing carers on a professional footing. The cost of registration should be borne by providers. This register is not a criticism of hard-working care staff, and should increase their status and security, while registration of senior staff will enable them to be held accountable if they fail to provide good care.

attributes.action: Restore meadows and limit pesticides to halt the decline of insects biodiversity
attributes.background: Parliament needs to consider robust strategies to restore meadows, to further restrict pesticides, and to encourage sustainable farming . The UK must be a leader in the fight against loss of biodiversity and show that ecological considerations are key to politics and business for a healthy future.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/science/insect-extinction-nature-climate-change-francisco-sanchez-bayo-sydney-science-a8773326.html 
https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0006320718313636 
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2015/may/18/losing-97-percent-britain-wildflower-meadows-matters-butterfly
 
97% of meadows have been lost in the UK since 1940. This is fuelling a massive decline in insect populations (part of a global decline). We must act to avoid mass insect loss

attributes.action: Bring renewable fuels like E85 (Bio ethanol) to UK petrol stations
attributes.background:
The Government should support company's (BP,Shell,Supermarket fuel suppliers, and others) to bring in and produce Ethanol fuels like E85 in the UK, and supply it at a cost lower then petrol.

This can be done via tax incentives or grants or how ever the government sees fit to do so.
attributes.additional_details:
As the governments moves to replace Diesel cars with petrol and electric car. more effort should also be given towards renewable fuels. bio ethanol can be produced by food waste products and improve vehicle emissions, solving two problems at once.

Vehicle manufactures can easily upgrade cars to run E85 and bio ethanol. All that is required is the installation of a flex fuel sensor and software upgrade. You will find that many variants of cars sold in the UK have this sensor installed in Europe. The cost of the sensor is as low as £50

This would be a good step forwards in reducing our dependence on fossil fuels. There has been great success with this in country's like Brazil and Australia

https://afdc.energy.gov/vehicles/flexible_fuel_emissions.html

attributes.action: Allow small businesses to sponsor a person known as an illegal worker.
attributes.background: The ongoing BREXIT chaos has affected the availability of low and medium skilled labour. There is a big workforce of illegal immigrants already in the country who can work in these jobs - some are already working.
attributes.additional_details: This will not only be helpful for small business to fulfil demand for the time being but also help to reduce the situation where some businesses abuse and misuse the workers only because they do not have the right to work.

attributes.action: Make identity theft a punishable crime
attributes.background: A fraudster entered into a loan agreement in my name, but I could not record it as a crime. Technically loan companies, banks and so on are the victims of such crimes.
attributes.additional_details: Identity theft should be a separate offence with the person whose identity is stolen identified as the victim and the identity thief punished.

attributes.action: Make cases of unfair dismissal appealable for any employee post-probation
attributes.background: Anyone who has served less than 2 years at a company has greatly reduced rights. Employers can easily make unfair dismissals in this period, unless it counts as automatically unfair. In any other case, including those which would lead to a concrete case against an employer, this is not appealable.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all care homes and nursing homes to install cameras/cctv
attributes.background:
There have been a number of criminal cases following allegations of physical, emotional and other abuse of vulnerable residents in care and nursing homes. 
These residents often have illnesses such as dementia, Alzheimer's disease and cannot report abuse themselves. They need protection not abuse.

attributes.action: Increase funding for suicide research & offer specialist support to stop it.
attributes.background: As a mother raising children in the UK, I have a burning desire to find out why suicide is on the increase, especially amongst the male age group 18 - 49, support needs to be given to stop it & assistance mechanisms should be put in place to stop these unnecessary deaths.
attributes.additional_details: Suicide can happen to any family at anytime & it leaves them devastated. We need to reach out to those who are susceptible and ensure that they are able to get any assistance they need before they make the difficult choice to take their own life. It is a silent killer and more most be done so that individuals considering it are able to open up and discuss their problems rather than feel that suicide is the only option.

attributes.action: Free menstrual cup given to all 11 year old girls to eliminate period poverty.
attributes.background: Period poverty can be stamped out and our government can do a lot more about it. Free menstral cups and education in how to use them should be given to 11 year old girls when they start secondary school. Half of all school girls needlessly miss at least one full day of school due to their period.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 10 girls aged 14 to 21 can’t afford menstrual products. 
A menstrual cup can last for up to 10 years.
Many women have been forced to use improvised alternatives such as socks and toilet roll.
An average cost of a period in the UK is £128 in a year. This would be a saving of £1,280 over 10 years.
Young women shouldn’t have their education needlessly compromised.
Use of menstrual cups will reduce non degradable sanitary products being sent to landfill and polluting our environment.

attributes.action: Charge supermarkets 1p for every item sold in non recyclable plastic
attributes.background: Most of us recycle every item we can. I am frustrated with trying to buy food without plastic packaging. They charge 5p for a plastic carrier, introduce a national compulsory charge for supermarkets of 1p per plastic wrapped item. They will develop alternatives which will help reduce plastic waste.

attributes.action: Parliament should not agree to the UK being part of an EU defence force
attributes.background: President of the Commission said that the EU is moving to having a single defence force. To avoid UK forces being committed to such a military force under EU law, Brexit agreement should contain clear legal drafting that excludes any such possibility

attributes.action: Homeoffice should not over charge health surcharge from UK Visa Applicants
attributes.background: UK Suppose Visa is issued for 33 Months however applicants are being charged for three Full years.
attributes.additional_details:
As per GOV.UK health surcharge for Visa Applicants is £200 per year at the moment as it going to be increased.
Why there is full 1 health surcharge where Visa is being issued for less than a year.
For example suppose Visa is issued for 33 months but Applicants have to pay health surcharge full £600 which is for 3 full years.

attributes.action: The UK should agree to the UN's Global Compact for Migration
attributes.background: The Global Compact seeks to safeguard the rights of migrants and reduce the negative effects of sudden high levels of migration, partially by reducing the structural problems in countries that cause irregular migration.  The Compact is simply a framework for co operation and not legally binding.
attributes.additional_details:
Global Compact pdf - https://refugeesmigrants.un.org/sites/default/files/180713_agreed_outcome_global_compact_for_migration.pdf

UN brief description of Compact's aims: https://refugeesmigrants.un.org/migration-compact

attributes.action: Introduce pet ambulances
attributes.background: Many animals get injured, choke or die in their homes and the only option is to take them to the vets which may be too late&not nice to do. My dog choked on her own food and we had to do the hymic manoeuvre to get the food out of her system. If we didn’t it could of been too late. They should exist.

attributes.action: Compulsory training for all services and organisations on all Assistance Dogs
attributes.background: We would like it to be compulsory for any organisation offering a product, service (whether public or private) or recreational events or activities whether or not publicly accessible to the public to have thorough, frequent, unbiased and accurate awareness training on ALL types of assistance dogs.
attributes.additional_details:
I am a handler of an owner trained assistance dog. Luckily I have only been refused access to a service once, but I know many people have had several access issues despite it being 2019.

I am happy to help with the rollout of this training and personally help to train people and organisations myself.

attributes.action: Initiate a Royal Commission examining Policing in the UK
attributes.background: Policing in the UK appears to be at crisis point- the last Royal Commision on Policing was held in 1962, over half a century ago. The policing landscape has significantly evolved in 56 years, and a review of policing practice in the UK is long overdue.

attributes.action: Stop insurers charging interest on monthly payments for motor premiums.
attributes.background: When taking out a motor insurance policy, you either pay for their premiums annually or monthly. However, often, monthly premiums attract high interest rates, making insurance more expensive. This is penalising low income families who can't afford to pay annually.
attributes.additional_details:
The Road Traffic Act 1930 made it a legal requirement to hold a valid motor insurance policy if you drive a car on the public highway with at least third party cover. However, many on lower incomes, who rely on their car, have no choice but to pay monthly and therefore penalised with interest loaded on. The law should be changed so they cannot add interest. 

Insurers say it costs to process monthly payments, but considering Direct Line Group, for example, made a £293.8m pre-tax profit in the first half of 2018 (https://www.directlinegroup.com/~/media/Files/D/Direct-Line-Group-V2/reports-and-presentations/h1-results-2018-annoucement.pdf), it's unfair.

attributes.action: Stop insurance discrimination affecting those with pre existing medical issues
attributes.background: Our society (rightly) talks about equality and yet the Government accepts insurance companies charging people more money for taking out policies - if they have a pre existing medical condition. It's blatant prejudice and discrimination. The government must stop this insurance industry-led practice.
attributes.additional_details: The Government has said (in a letter to MP David Davies) that this is a commercial matter. Yet human rights are not a commercial matter. Life & CIC insurance is necessary for security. The Universal Declaration of Human Rights says: Article 25. (1) Everyone has the right to security in the event of unemployment, sickness, disability... in circumstances beyond his control. 'Everyone' includes people with pre existing medical conditions who cannot afford higher premiums for life/CIC insurance.

attributes.action: Require fathers who pay child support to be named on the birth certificate.
attributes.background: It seems today we have a very unfair systems in which a resident parent can prevent a non-resident parent from having any rights, prevent visitation and still claim money.
attributes.additional_details:
If a mother knows who the father is, it should be a requirement that they are named on the birth certificate, before any claims for child support can be made. 
Today we talk about how everyone should be treated equally, yet it seems unless you're the father of child out of wedlock. It equality of parents has been forgotten.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of early cancer symptoms among GPs
attributes.background: After recent family dealings with cancer and previous friends I have known dying from cancer it was evident that the GP's involved were at a loss to diagnose what was happening which may have contributed to the disease not being treated early enough resulting in prolonged suffering.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should provide more training on the symptoms and tests that can spot cancer early.

attributes.action: Stop the resale of concert tickets on secondary websites above face value price
attributes.background:
Concert tickets sell out within minutes due to use of specialist software purchasing them in mass.

New laws put in place earlier this year have seemingly made no difference.
attributes.additional_details:
Reselling football tickets is illegal under section 166 Criminal Justice and Public Order Act 1994. This prevents touts from buying and reselling at inflated prices. 

We need something similar for concert tickets. One option is to not allow secondary sites to resell concert tickets for more than the face value, excluding transaction fees and a small fee to ensure profit for the site. Selling at a highly inflated rate should not be allowed. It's unbeneficial for fans and the music business alike. 

The fan fair alliance goes into more detail on this - http://fanfairalliance.org/faqs/

attributes.action: Ban tenancies that require rent paid in advance for social housing
attributes.background: Becuase im on universal credit I have to pay £20 pound on top of my rent. Because my rent is meant to be paid in advance but the housing element is paid in arreas, and if I dont pay this I will be breaching my tenacy agreement, I want social housing to be banned from making tenancies like this.
attributes.additional_details: Or if they cant stop making tenancies like this make universal credit housing element paid weekly.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for Supermarkets to give all leftover produce to homeless
attributes.background: The amount of food waste by Supermarket’s in the UK stands at 1.9 million tonnes and that is simply sickening when there are 8 million people living in food poverty today.

attributes.action: Make the use of mobile phones while driving an instant driving ban.
attributes.background:
As an approved driving instructor Every day i see drivers using their phones Clearly the 6 points and £200 fine have not had the desired effect to make people stop using phones while driving
I firmly believe that a three month driving ban would help greatly stop drivers using phones as they drive
attributes.additional_details: I  firmly believe that a three month driving ban would help greatly stop drivers using phones as they drive.making it difficult to get to work without a car . If  put in this position then it will make them think before using the phone while driving.

attributes.action: More effort to increase the peace process between Israel and Palestine
attributes.background: The UK Government should carry out a detailed review of all its efforts towards facilitating the peace process between Israel and Palestine. This review should identify what hasn’t been done and recommend new action that the Government could take.
attributes.additional_details: For so long people have seen these two states as enemies and for too long innocent people have been brought into a conflict which deeply effects the progression of life in this area of the world. It is time for this to stop.

attributes.action: Fund clinical trials in Alzheimer's based on the aldehyde toxicity hypothesis
attributes.background: There is increasing evidence to suggest Alzheimer's is caused by aldehyde toxicity. It stands to reason that medical protocol based on this hypothesis could be invaluable in the prevention and treatment of this devastating neurodegenerative condition afflicting the ageing population.
attributes.additional_details:
Public funding should be used to investigate a therapeutic cocktail of the following compounds in clinical trials to reduce the economic burden of Alzheimer's and dementia and improve quality of life in the ageing population:

N-acetylcysteine (NAC)
Niacin (nicotinic acid form)
Zinc
Molybdenum
Alpha lipoic acid
Selenium
Sulforaphane

Collectively, these compounds are integral in aldehyde detoxification and would present a powerful weapon against neurodegenerative disorders such as Alzheimer's.

attributes.action: Educate children and teenagers about Learning Disabilities and Mental Health
attributes.background: 1 in 4 people will have a mental health illness. 1 in 50 people have a learning disability. These figures are increasing and everyone will come into contact with people with mental health issues and learning disabilities on a regular basis. So it is important to know and understand these disorders.
attributes.additional_details: A lack of understanding and fear of the unknown is causing people with Mental Health and Learning Disabilities to become increasingly vulnerable and separated from society. To integrate everyone, including the Mental health and Learning Disability population, creating awareness and understand should decrease behaviours, such as bullying and mate crime, which is significantly higher for vulnerable people. Educating people from a young age should make these stigmatized groups more accepted.

attributes.action: Remove the 2 year restriction on a 125cc motorcycle upon completion of the CBT.
attributes.background: If you can ride a 125cc for 2 years why not permanently.

attributes.action: Require distinct Mental Health emergency departments within pre existing A&E’s
attributes.background: Mental health among British citizens is a rising concern.  Standard Accident and Emergency departments are not suitable for patients experiencing a psychiatric crisis.  Busy, loud waiting rooms are discouraging to attending psychiatric patients and the facilities pose risks as well as unsettlement.
attributes.additional_details: Psychiatric patients who aren’t in a critical or unstable physical situation would benefit from alternative waiting room set ups and resus style departments.  Basic safety precautions should be put in place for furniture & bathroom designs.  Provision of RMNs on duty to interact with patients whilst they wait.  Side rooms available for highly distressed individuals & for those having to wait several hours to be seen.  Access to sensory & distraction items to ease anxiety/agitation.

attributes.action: Reduce normal rate-VAT to 8% on takeaway food
attributes.background: The normal rate VAT 20% on takeaway food. It is very high, Most shops are not able to pay the liability and they start cheating the system. Almost all individual owned takeaway shops are hiding their turnover.
attributes.additional_details: In Switzerland the rate 7.7% and in Germany 7% for takeaway foods.

attributes.action: Abolish the private education system by nationalising private schools.
attributes.background:
Private schools have always been a tool for the wealthy to ensure they have the best opportunities in life. 

For a society in which equal opportunity is one of the core principles, it is a disgrace to allow an inherent advantage to some children based on the size of their parents’ wealth.
attributes.additional_details:
Students from private schools were 8% more likely than the average student to attend an Oxbridge university in 2016. Apart from a better chance at higher grades, this is part of the high quality reputation schools like Eton gain, which makes them much more likely to get in.

It is this unfairness that means we are calling on the Government to take private schools under public control, give them the same funding as other state schools, and ensure there is greater equality of opportunity for all.

attributes.action: Review the provision of hospital meals.
attributes.background: Every hospital has a responsibility to provide the highest level of care possible for their patients and this  includes the quality and nutritional value of the food served
attributes.additional_details: Whilst meals are provided three times per day, they are not always edible and are often left on a heated trolley which changes the taste & texture of foods, often making the meals inedible, particularly to the more vulnerable

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to show all materials used in clothing and footwear.
attributes.background:
At present some clothing and footwear is insufficiently labelled. All materials used should be clearly labelled for consumers.

Individuals may not wish to wear products that contain leather from animals or particular animals such as pigs in accordance with their values or beliefs.

attributes.action: Legislate an affordable car insurance maximum premium for younger drivers.
attributes.background: The current ability for insurance companies to charge in excess of £1500 for a 1lt small car for younger drivers is a detriment to the ability of young people to make themselves mobile and thus employable. I would ask that the house assesses the possibility of a price cap for Car insurance in the UK
attributes.additional_details: Of course, it is expected that more powerful vehicles are charged at a higher premium, however, the government's ability to help young people become more mobile within the uk offers huge benefits to both the individual and the winder economy. It is argued that the leading cause of unisured drivers in the uk is cost and so this practice also could contribute to a reduction of uninsured deivers on the road thus elevating some risk to other drivers. Let us not price young people out of mobility.

attributes.action: Establish a Parliamentary Proxy Voting Procedure
attributes.background: An MP was forced to delay a caesarean section to deliver her baby in order to be in Parliament on 15 January 2019 to vote on the Government's plan to leave the EU.  We urge parliament to establish a proxy voting procedure for MPs who require parental, medical or bereavement leave.
attributes.additional_details: The only option for MPs who cannot be present in Parliament is to be paired with one from the other side of an issue who agrees not to vote.  The pairing system is informal, and was shown to be ineffective last July when MP Brandon Lewis broke a pairing arrangement with MP Jo Swinson, who was on maternity leave.  Our elected representatives must be allowed to represent us without having to compromise their children's health and well-being, their own health, or their families' urgent needs.

attributes.action: Increase Government funding for Wokingham Borough Council
attributes.background:
In 2018/19 WBC received £82.47 per resident from the Government compared to neighbouring LAs West Berkshire £111.03, Bracknell £167.77, and Reading £215.28.

It's expected that funding will further reduce between 2018/19 and 2019/20 from £82.47 per WBC resident to just £40.64
attributes.additional_details: We need to put a stop to this poor funding, as we should be investing in this beautiful town, not letting it's standards drop as the council is forced to make more and more cuts.

attributes.action: Test for Category D Should entitle license holder to drive Class 2 ( Vice versa)
attributes.background: I strongly believe (Along with many HGV ancoach drivers) that if you pass the driving test for buses (Category D) this should then entitle the license holder to drive any vehicle up to 7500 kg.
attributes.additional_details: On a category D licences you can drive an 18000kg Tri Axle coach but not a 7500kg truck. Although the coach may be longer and taller. This doesn’t make any sense. I also believe that with Category D on your license, you should be able to tow any trailer on your car when over the age of 25.

attributes.action: Review laws making baby-changing facilities more accessible to fathers.
attributes.background: TheDadsnet hear daily from dad's who haven’t had access to safe places to change their baby’s nappy. Including an NHS hospital. We want the government to change the laws around the provision of baby changing facilities accessible to fathers, like former President Obama did in  the USA.
attributes.additional_details: "When we arrived at the hospital my son needed a nappy change. I checked the men's and disabled toilets for changing facilities to find none. I asked at the information desk where baby changing was and was told it was only in the ladies. I asked where dads were expected to change their babies and was told to ask a nurse to use a side room but not to bank on them allowing it. I ended up changing my son's nappy on the floor in a corridor." Dadsnet Member.

attributes.action: Review the act of rehoming lost dogs from 7 days to 28 days
attributes.background: 7 days does not give the owner time to come forward. Especially as there are certain legal procedures to follow. There is not enough information of what steps to take. The awaiting reports from vets and Dog wardens does not make the 7 day ruling realistic.
attributes.additional_details: When a family pet goes missing what steps do you take at this distressing time.? There should be a simple guideline, but also a time limit that reflects all the necessary searches and avenue's the distraught owner has to endure with  this very stressful ordeal. A plan of action put into place with a cap on fees. This would stop the monies being the incentive for unscrupulous organisations.

attributes.action: Require every vehicle manufactured to have their lights constantly on
attributes.background: Daytime running lights also known as (Drls) are dangerous, travelling around the country I’ve seen far too many people driving at nighttime with only the vehicle drls on, which unfortunately are only on the front of vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: As a professional driver (hgv) I believe drls are very dangerous and all motor vehicles manufactured should now constantly have their lights on, best example car is the Volvo, if the switch is positioned on (0) then the headlights are still on! Several times I have been close to a collision due to this and personally I don’t think it would be fair for anyone to have an accident and potentially injure or even kill a person or family and get punished for it for the sake of making it a legal requirement that vehicle lights are constantly on.

attributes.action: Clarity on the conditions in which Sec. of State for NI would call a border poll
attributes.background: In absence of clarity in the Good Friday Belfast agreement, I wish to request the Secretary of state for NI clarify the conditions that must be met to call a border poll on Irish reunification.

attributes.action: Make School Meals More Affordable
attributes.background: I am concerned that some schools are charging exorbitant prices for School Meals which could easily prove costly for parents, long term. As a solution, I would like to see the Education Act amended to cap School Meal prices at a level affordable to low and middle-income earners.

attributes.action: Online retail companies should pay an equivalent to UK high street rates.
attributes.background:
The High Street is suffering, losing thousands of jobs because online suppliers offer low paid jobs in distribution centres that pay minimal local business rates.
 
Many pay low corporation tax and again gain an unfair advantage over British and other tax paying businesses
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/aug/02/amazon-halved-uk-corporation-tax-bill-to-45m-last-year
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-45053528
 
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/amazon-now-pay-even-less-13023482
 
https://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/998509/amazon-uk-tax-high-street-shops-business-tax-income-tax-taxation-system
 
https://www.ft.com/content/8fcf026e-38e0-11e8-8b98-2f31af407cc8

attributes.action: Posthumously award service medals to the now pardoned WW1 soldiers Shot at Dawn
attributes.background: In 2006 the UK govt granted a pardon to the 306 British soldiers shot at dawn for cowardice or desertion. Whilst that provided some closure for their families, I propose that their living relatives should now receive their service medals as they are as deserving as their fallen comrades.
attributes.additional_details: I walked from the UK to the grave of Stockton’s George Hunter in Esquelbecq, France to ensure that his memory was preserved. His story has been a focus of our commemoration in Stockton on tees and a source of immense comfort to his grand daughter. I believe that in the spirit of reconciliation and understanding she, and the families of the other shot at dawn soldiers should receive the medals that their ancestors earned in the conflict.

attributes.action: Reopen the Exeter to Plymouth Railway line via Okehampton
attributes.background:
Exeter to Plymouth has currently one railway line connecting two big cities. The current railway line in bad weather is always being closed to trains. This cuts off Plymouth and Cornwall from the rest of the country.
Reopening the Okehampton route will help the situation.

attributes.action: Amend the Sexual Offence Act 2003 to include female rape
attributes.background: The current Sexual Offences Act 2003 is gender-bias as the law only legally recognises sexual offences committed by males as rape. This neglects those (males and females) who have been have been sexually assaulted by females.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose the following changes to the legislation 
 
Rape 
1) A person (A) commits an offence if— 
(a) A intentionally penetrates the vagina, anus or mouth of another person (B) with any part of person's (A) body, 
(b) A intentionally penetrates their own vagina, anus or mouth with another person’s (B) body, 
(c) B does not consent to the penetration, and 
(d)A does not reasonably believe that B consents.

attributes.action: Require MPs to give a full explanation when they refuse to represent you.
attributes.background: MP can refuse to represent constituents and choose not to reply to any form of communication unless legally obligated eg subject access request. They do not need to give an explanation, it leaves constituents cut off from all lines of communication if they wish to ask questions of their government.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no way to challenge their decision. 

Apparently it’s an MP’s democratic right to not represent you or give an explanation which I find utterly ridiculous as they are there to hold the government accountable. 

This ability that MPs have to cut off constituents from questioning their government is wholly unacceptable. The rules should be changed so they have to give an explanation.

attributes.action: Reduce tax on fuel for the road haulage industry
attributes.background: Reduce fuel tax for the road haulage industry.
attributes.additional_details: Fuel is the biggest out may in road haulage. The cost is increasing and forcing small business into financial stuggle. The reduce in tax would encourage hauliers to expand and boost the economy. Increase wages run more fuel efficient/green vehicles
